meanings.definition: To be in charge or control of something.
meanings.sent1: She bossed the group project and made sure everything was done on time.
meanings.sent2: The manager bossed the team to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cat bossed around the other pets in the house, acting like the leader.
meanings.sent4: The sun bossed the sky, shining brightly and illuminating everything below.
meanings.sent5: The teacher bossed the classroom with authority, keeping the students in line.

meanings.definition: To give orders or direction to others.
meanings.sent1: He bossed his siblings around, telling them what to do.
meanings.sent2: The coach bossed the players during the game, guiding their every move.
meanings.sent3: The toddler bossed the toys, arranging them in a specific order.
meanings.sent4: The wind bossed the leaves, swirling them in different directions.
meanings.sent5: The director bossed the actors, instructing them on their roles in the play.

meanings.definition: Having a protruding or rounded shape.
meanings.sent1: The bossed handle on the door was easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The bossed edges of the coin made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent3: The bossed bump on his head from the fall looked funny.
meanings.sent4: The bossed hills in the distance created a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The bossed button on the shirt added a unique touch to the design.
